New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers improved to 14-0, marking the best start in the club's 55-year existence.
Cleveland Cavaliers set a franchise record for points in a quarter with 49 in the first.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points.
Coby White scored 29 points for the Bulls.
Nikola Vucevic had 25 points for the Bulls.
Ayo Dosunmu’s dunk brought the Bulls within four points with 2:55 left.
LeVert and Mitchell dropped 3-pointers as the Cavs blitzed the Bulls 21-7 the rest of the way.
Mitchell opened the fourth quarter with a 3-pointer and scored Cleveland’s first nine points of the period, totaling 18 points in the last 12 minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavs are playing with energy and a connectivity that’s only building their confidence and trust in first-year coach Kenny Atkinson.
The Bulls had too many rushed shots and poor possessions to pull off the win.
Others: The Cavs played without starting forward Evan Mobley, who has been battling an illness.
